info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 4:58PM EDT until June 17 at 5:45PM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: The National Weather Service in Greenville-Spartanburg has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Southern Davie County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northeastern Iredell County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... Northwestern Rowan County in the Piedmont of North Carolina... * Until 545 PM EDT. * At 458 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 6 miles southwest of Mocksville, moving southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Mocksville, Cooleemee, Harmony, Turnersburg, Piedmont Research Station, Woodleaf, Cool Springs, Cleveland, Sheffield and Olin. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with this storm, and may lead to minor flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Please report damaging winds, hail, or flooding to the National Weather Service by calling toll free, 1, 800, 2 6 7, 8 1 0 1, or by posting on our Facebook page, or Tweet it using hashtag nwsgsp. Your message should describe the event and the specific location where it occurred.
